body_html:
I am trying 1.9.0 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/serving/1.9.0/tensorflow_serving/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu

Had to make the following changes: set the branch to r1.9
Comment out the stubs to prevent cuInit fails like in tensorflow/serving#1015

...
ARG TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH=r1.9
...
#RUN ln -s /usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs/libcuda.so /usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs/libcuda.so.1
#ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
...

then

ln -s Dockerfile.devel-gpu Dockerfile
nvidia-docker build -t tensorflow-serving-r1.9-gpu .

This leads to a fully working build!

Please, any way of building that requires less manual intervention to create a stable GPU build is welcome!

body:
I am trying 1.9.0 https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/serving/1.9.0/tensorflow_serving/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu 

Had to make the following changes: set the branch to r1.9
Comment out the stubs to prevent cuInit fails like in https://github.com/tensorflow/serving/issues/1015
```
...
ARG TF_SERVING_VERSION_GIT_BRANCH=r1.9
...
#RUN ln -s /usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs/libcuda.so /usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs/libcuda.so.1
#ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
...
```
then 
```
ln -s Dockerfile.devel-gpu Dockerfile
nvidia-docker build -t tensorflow-serving-r1.9-gpu .
```
This leads to a fully working build! 

Please, any way of building that requires less manual intervention to create a stable GPU build is welcome!
